intro: Sclerosperma profizianum, commonly known as the African milkwood tree, is a deciduous tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by woody, capsule-like fruits containing flat, winged seeds. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often found in savannas and rocky areas. The tree has cultural and medicinal significance in some local communities.
